trans-unit.source: Records of high energy gamma particle bursts along with background noise, both simulated using a Monte Carlo process.<html></html> <html></html>The intent of the simulation was to improve the accuracy of ground-based atmospheric Cherenkov gamma telescopes, using statistical methods to differentiate between the desired signal (Cherenkov radiation showers) and background noise (hadronic showers initiated by cosmic rays in the upper atmosphere).<html></html> <html></html>The data has been pre-processed to create an elongated cluster with the long axis is oriented towards the camera center.

trans-unit.source: The characteristics of this ellipse, (often called Hillas parameters) are among the image parameters that can be used for discrimination.<html></html> <html></html><html></html>Usage:<html></html> Predict whether image of a shower represents signal or background noise.<html></html> <html></html><html></html>Notes:<html></html> Simple classification accuracy is not meaningful for this data, since classifying a background event as signal is worse than classifying a signal event as background.
